programme.title: UFC 314: Volkanovski vs Lopes Prelims
programme.desc: Scheduled preliminary bouts: Dan Ige (18-9-0) vs. Sean Woodson (13-1-1) in a featherweight bout; Yan Xiaonan (19-4) vs. Virna Jandiroba (21-3) in a strawweight bout; Jim Miller (38-18-0) vs. Chase Hooper (15-3-1) in a lightweight bout.

programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: Expert analysts preview the upcoming action in the NBA, evaluating the strengths and weaknesses of each team while breaking down the pivotal matchups; coverage includes exclusive interviews, insightful commentary and special features.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Milwaukee beat Detroit in their last two consecutive meetings, winning the most recent matchup on Dec. 3 with a 128-107 scoreline; Giannis Antetokounmpo posted 28 points for the Bucks in the win while teammate Damian Lillard added 27.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Probable starters: TBD vs. Tyler Glasnow (1-0, 6.43); Glasnow issued five walks over two innings in his last start at Philadelphia, but the right-hander has a career record of 11-4 with a 3.32 ERA during the month of April.

programme.title: NBA Courtside
programme.desc: Players get prepared for the upcoming game through their warm-up routines, as cameras go around the arena to see the fans get excited with tipoff nearing and capture the pregame energy before the starting five lineups are announced.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Los Angeles claimed wins over Golden State in their last three consecutive meetings, winning the most recent matchup on Dec. 27 with a 102-92; Norman Powell posted 26 points for the Clippers in the win while the Warriors' Jonathan Kuminga had 34.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight: Sunday Night Countdown
programme.desc: A preview of the upcoming Major League Baseball game with expert analysis, insightful observations and exclusive interviews; coverage includes highlights of Major League Baseball games and the latest baseball news with knowledgeable commentary.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: Colorado won 13 of its last 15 meetings with the Ducks after a 4-2 win on Dec. 20 behind a goal and two assists from Nathan MacKinnon, along with a goal and assist from Cale Makar; Anaheim is 21-17-2 at home this season despite a losing road record.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: Malika Andrews covers the latest news from around the NBA, breaking down the stories making headlines across the league, highlights and takeaways from recent games, and guest interviews to get a unique perspective on the league.

programme.title: WNBA Countdown
programme.desc: Expert analysts preview the upcoming action in the WNBA, evaluating the strengths and weaknesses of each team while breaking down the pivotal matchups; coverage includes exclusive interviews, insightful commentary and special features.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee and his friends deliver one-of-a-kind opinions on the latest news making headlines in sports and entertainment, along with special segments and guest interviews with some of the biggest names to give a unique experience.

programme.title: 2025 WNBA Draft
programme.desc: Dallas Wings hold the No. 1 pick in the 2025 WNBA Draft, followed by Seattle and Washington, as teams address needs on their rosters; Paige Bueckers, Olivia Miles and Kiki Iriafen are top prospects expected to hear their names early.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: A panel of reporters from across the country debate trending topics and stories in sports with points being awarded for valid arguments, and at the end of the show, the winner is awarded 30 uninterrupted seconds to discuss any topic of their choice.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon, longtime colleagues and friends, engage in verbal sparring during a fast-paced and wide-ranging discussion about current events in the world of sports; Kornheiser and Wilbon also interview special guests.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: Mike Greenberg, who joined ESPN in 1996 as an anchor, joins former NBA star Jalen Rose for roundtable discussions about the latest sports news making headlines as well as analysis of recent big games and interviews with expert commentators.

programme.title: NFL2Night
programme.desc: The latest news and reports around the NFL are discussed in detail with a panel of expert analysts weighing in on the hottest issues, while veteran football reporters provide up-to-date information from team headquarters across the league.

programme.title: ESPN First Take
programme.desc: Molly Qerim is the moderator while veteran commentators Stephen A. Smith and Max Kellerman discuss and deliberate the latest topics in the world of sports; the debate show also features guest appearances by entertainers, athletes and journalists.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: Malika Andrews covers the latest news from around the NBA, breaking down the stories making headlines across the league, highlights and takeaways from recent games, and guest interviews to get a unique perspective on the league.

programme.title: Eight on Eight
programme.desc: Eight individuals share the lasting impact the late Kobe Bryant had on their lives, showing how the five-time NBA champion was able to reach everyday individuals and how their interactions would change the course of their livelihood.

programme.title: NWSL Soccer
programme.desc: Bay FC and Chicago split victories in their two meetings from the 2024 season, with Bay winning the final matchup on June 8 through a 2-1 scoreline; Kiki Pickett and Joelle Anderson found the net for Bay in the win away from home.

programme.title: College Bowling
programme.desc: College bowling culminates with the NCAA Championships where four teams compete after the double-elimination regional rounds; No. 1 ranked Jacksonville State looks to defend its 2024 title against Nebraska, Youngstown State and Wichita State.

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: Four-time defending champion Max Verstappen cut his deficit to Lando Norris to one point after winning at Japan; Verstappen averaged 201.582 kph last year en route to his second-straight win at Bahrain, beating Sergio Perez by 22.457 seconds.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: Gracyn Tucker, who enters the series with a .319 batting average, leads Georgia Tech in home runs, RBIs, runs and total bases this season; North Carolina's Kat Rodriguez leads the ACC and ranks first in the nation in RBIs coming into the matchup.

programme.title: SportsCenter Special
programme.desc: Field Yates reveals the fourth edition of his mock 2025 NFL Draft, going over the changes he made from his third mock, the players that are rising and falling on his board, along with the best fits for teams looking to address needs.

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: Analysts preview the Bahrain Grand Prix and four-time champion Max Verstappen, who comes off a win at Japan and won at Bahrain last year, going over the latest news from pit road and updated track conditions, along with their predictions on who wins.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: In the summer of 1998, the St. Louis Cardinals' Mark McGwire and the Chicago Cubs' Sammy Sosa embarked on a chase of one of Major League Baseball's most hallowed records, igniting the passion and imagination of fans and non-fans everywhere.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The Lakers beat Philadelphia in the NBA Finals in 1980, 1982 and 1983, while Boston won the crown by beating Houston in 1981; Los Angeles and Boston staged the first of three epic battles in 1984, and the rivalry transformed fans' view of the game.

programme.title: ESPN Films
programme.desc: The Los Angeles Dodgers and New York Yankees meet in the World Series in back-to-back years in 1977 and 1978, creating a cross-country rivalry featuring unique storylines throughout both dugouts and memorable moments in each series.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: In 1978, the Celtics drafted Larry Bird, but he played his final year at Indiana State before signing; Los Angeles selected Magic Johnson No. 1 in 1979 after he led Michigan State to a victory over Bird and the Sycamores in the NCAA title game.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The Lakers and Celtics met in the NBA Finals for the first time in 1959, and in the 1960s the two franchises battled for the title six times; Bill Russell was a dominant figure for the Celtics, and Los Angeles featured Jerry West and Elgin Baylor.

programme.title: ESPN Films
programme.desc: The most remarkable sports stories are featured, as storytellers break away from the traditional view of a sports film and showcasing stories of passion, triumph, loss and resurgence of athletes, as featured guests share their side of the story.

programme.title: First Draft
programme.desc: ESPN experts Field Yates and Mel Kiper Jr. follow the NFL Draft throughout the year, breaking down the stock of players who have risen and fallen during the college football season, what each team needs to draft and the latest trade news.

programme.title: Hey Rookie, Welcome to the NFL
programme.desc: Cameras follow the newest members of the NFL as they go through the draft, preseason, training camp, numerous hazing rituals instigated by veteran players, and an assortment of other situations that will test each rookie's mettle.

programme.desc: Evan Cohen, Chris Canty and Michelle Smallmon discuss the latest stories from around the world of sports making headlines, previewing some of the biggest games in the coming days, and guest interviews to gather their unique perspective.

programme.title: E:60
programme.desc: On June 2, 2010, Detroit Tigers pitcher Armando Galarraga was one out away from the first perfect game in franchise history, but a wrong call by umpire Jim Joyce would spoil that opportunity and cause backlash on a worldwide scale.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Livan and Orlando Hernandez risked their lives to defect from Cuba in order to play Major League Baseball in the United States, and the two half-brothers made an unlikely journey from the impoverished island nation to pitching in the World Series.

programme.desc: Host and sports oddsmakers break down the latest betting action around sports, discussing some of the most recent lines on the marquee matchups and the upsets that bettors should be aware of before putting their money down on the game.

programme.title: Eight on Eight
programme.desc: Eight individuals share the lasting impact the late Kobe Bryant had on their lives, showing how the five-time NBA champion was able to reach everyday individuals and how their interactions would change the course of their livelihood.

programme.title: SportsCenter Special
programme.desc: Mel Kiper Jr. and Todd McShay expound on their mock drafts, alternating picks through three rounds to predict how the 32 teams fill several holes on their roster, the players they believe who have improved their stock and the names that could fall.

programme.title: SportsCenter Special
programme.desc: NFL Draft experts analyze the quarterback class and review potential landing spots; top names expected to hear their name called early include: Miami's Cam Ward, Colorado's Shedeur Sanders, Alabama's Jalen Milroe and Ole Miss' Jaxson Dart.

programme.title: Numbers on the Board
programme.desc: Four friends talk all things NBA basketball and provide their unique perspectives, breaking down results from the recent games, the latest news making headlines across the league and rumors making the rounds that could create waves.

programme.title: SportsCenter Special
programme.desc: Mel Kiper Jr. reveals the fourth edition of his mock 2025 NFL Draft, going over the changes he made from his third mock, the players that are rising and falling on his board, along with the best fits for teams looking to address needs.

programme.title: Gr8tness
programme.desc: A record once thought to be untouchable, Alex Ovechkin gives an all-access look as he chases the 894 goals of the legendary Wayne Gretzky, showing how he prepares for his games and the pressure he is facing to break the prestigious record.

programme.title: NHRA Qualifying
programme.desc: The top drag racers in the country attempt to make the show through qualifying times in Top Fuel, Funny Car, Pro Stock and other classifications; the drivers who qualify with the fastest times advance to the elimination rounds.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: Freshman Alex DeBoer, the daughter of Alabama head football coach Kalen DeBoer, enters the series with a .367 batting average and leads Washington in home runs and RBIs this season; No. 7-ranked UCLA ranks 11th nationally with a 2.04 team ERA.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Qualifying
programme.desc: IndyCar drivers aim for the best starting spot in the Grand Prix of Long Beach, and the driver with the fastest time is awarded pole position; Felix Rosenqvist averaged 107.317 mph to win the pole last year before finishing the race in ninth.

programme.title: Bassmaster Elite Series
programme.desc: The highest level of professional bass fishing features pro anglers competing all season for the opportunity to win points toward the Progressive Bassmaster Angler of the Year award and to qualify for the Bassmaster Classic.

programme.title: NHRA Drag Racing
programme.desc: The top drag racing teams in the country compete in Top Fuel, Pro Stock and Funny Car; drivers accumulate points based on the results of each event and at the end of the season a champion is crowned in the various categories.

programme.title: IndyCar Warmup
programme.desc: Analysts preview Grand Prix of Long Beach and two-time champion Alex Palou, who comes off a win at Thermal Club to increase his lead, going over the latest news from pit road and updated track conditions, along with their predictions on who wins.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Denny Hamlin won back-to-back Cup Series races for the first time since 2012 following his victory at Darlington over points leader William Byron; Hamlin and Kyle Larson won the two races at Bristol last year over Martin Truex Jr. and Chase Elliott.

programme.title: The American Rodeo
programme.desc: Over $3 million in prize money is awarded, including a $1 million bonus for the winner of the championship round, as 15 athletes compete in each of the eight rodeo disciplines compete against the top 5 ranked athletes in their events.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Probable starters: Jordan Hicks (1-0, 2.36) vs. Will Warren (0-0, 6.00) Hicks is holding opponents to a .171 batting average in two starts for the Giants, and Warren has nine strikeouts over nine innings for the Yankees.

programme.title: NASCAR Race Day
programme.desc: RaceDay previews the Food City 500 and Denny Hamlin, who comes off back-to-back wins and won two of the last three races at Bristol, going over the latest news from pit road and updated track conditions, along with their predictions.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Arlington (2-0) remained undefeated with an 11-9 win over Houston behind 211 passing yards and a touchdown from Luis Perez; Birmingham (1-1) rebounded from its loss to DC with a 21-12 win over Michigan behind Matt Corral and Deon Cain.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Denny Hamlin won back-to-back Cup Series races for the first time since 2012 following his victory at Darlington over points leader William Byron; Hamlin and Kyle Larson won the two races at Bristol last year over Martin Truex Jr. and Chase Elliott.

programme.title: Driven Speed: Keanu Reeves vs. Cody Jones
Driven Speed: Keanu Reeves vs. Cody Jones
Indycar NICS Racing
programme.desc: Two-time defending champion Alex Palou increased its lead over Pato O'Ward to 39 points after winning at Thermal Club for a second-straight victory; Scott Dixon averaged 98.35 mph en route to his win at Long Beach last year over Colton Herta.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Racing
programme.desc: Two-time defending champion Alex Palou increased its lead over Pato O'Ward to 39 points after winning at Thermal Club for a second-straight victory; Scott Dixon averaged 98.35 mph en route to his win at Long Beach last year over Colton Herta.

programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Two-time champion Francesco Bagnaia secured his first win of the season with his victory at COTA, while Alex Marquez passed his brother, Marc, in the standings by one point; Jorge Martin won the sprint race at Qatar last year over Brad Binder.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.title: Pro Volleyball Federation
programme.desc: Columbus claimed victories over Vegas in their first two meetings of the 2025 season, winning the most recent matchup on March 14 with a 3-0 scoreline; Izabella Rapacz posted a game-leading 20 kills for the Fury in the win at home.

programme.title: The American Rodeo
programme.desc: Over $3 million in prize money is awarded, including a $1 million bonus for the winner of the championship round, as 15 athletes compete in each of the eight rodeo disciplines compete against the top 5 ranked athletes in their events.

programme.desc: The top drag racing teams in the country compete in different classifications; drivers accumulate points based on the results of each event and at the end of the season a champion is crowned in the various drag-racing classes.

programme.title: European Poker Tour
programme.desc: Big-money poker events in some of Europe's most exclusive and exciting destinations, features some of the best players in the world attempting to take huge pots by employing the right strategy and taking advantage of their opponents' mistakes.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: STIHL Timbersports Series
programme.desc: Competitive lumberjacks oppose each other in various disciplines based on traditional logging skills in an effort to determine the best all-around lumberjack; Hot Saw, Single Buck, Springboard Chop, Standing Block Chop, Stock Saw and Underhand Chop.

programme.title: Australian Football League
programme.desc: GWS (3-1-0) has won the two previous meetings, including an 80-79 triumph at Manuka Oval last season, as Giants substitute James Peatling scored a late mark; St. Kilda (3-1-0) seeks fourth-straight win after beating Port Adelaide, 89-72, on April 6.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Daniel Hemric secured his first Truck Series win of his career with a victory at Martinsville over Tyler Ankrum; Christian Eckes averaged 80.017 mph en route to his win in the race at Bristol last year, beating Kyle Busch by 0.141 seconds.

programme.title: Australian Football League
programme.desc: Hawthorn (4-0-0) comes off its bye week in Round 4 allowing just 71.3 points per contest; Port Adelaide (1-3-0) has won five of the past six meetings, including a 75-72 victory in last season's semifinals, as MItch Georgiades booted three goals.

programme.title: America's Day at the Races
programme.desc: Nationwide coverage of thoroughbred racing from venues around the country, showcasing major stakes races with in-depth analysis from expert handicappers; coverage includes the latest horse racing news, exclusive interviews and insightful commentary.

programme.title: MLS Soccer
programme.desc: New England and Atlanta split victories in their two meetings from the 2024 season, with the Revolution winning the final matchup on July 3 with a 2-1 scoreline; Giacomo Vrioni found the net with a brace for New England in the win at home.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: Bowlers compete for a $100,000 top prize in the final; Bill O'Neill captured the 14th title and the third major PBA championship of his career with a 209-178 victory over top-seeded Tom Smallwood in last year's edition held in Wichita, Kan.

programme.title: Bassmasters
programme.desc: The top anglers across the country compete in a series of annual events that makes up bass fishing's most competitive league, featuring millions of dollars in prizes, tournaments taking place throughout the U.S., and coverage of all the major phases.

programme.title: NHRA Qualifying
programme.desc: The top drag racers in the country attempt to make the show through qualifying times in Top Fuel, Funny Car, Pro Stock and other classifications; the drivers who qualify with the fastest times advance to the elimination rounds.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: Bowlers compete in the preliminary rounds of the PBA members-only Tier 1 major championship for a top prize of $100,000; Bill O'Neill captured his third career major championship with a 209-178 victory over Tom Smallwood in last year's edition.

programme.title: The American Rodeo
programme.desc: Cowboys, ranging in age from 11 to 53 and representing 31 states and fourth countries, compete in saddle bronc, steer wrestling, tie-down roping, bull riding, breakaway, bareback riding, barrel racing and team roping.

programme.desc: The top drag racing teams in the country compete in different classifications; drivers accumulate points based on the results of each event and at the end of the season a champion is crowned in the various drag-racing classes.

programme.desc: Cowboys, ranging in age from 11 to 53 and representing 31 states and fourth countries, compete in saddle bronc, steer wrestling, tie-down roping, bull riding, breakaway, bareback riding, barrel racing and team roping.

programme.title: NHRA Pro Mod Series
programme.desc: The top pro modified drivers compete against each other with three different engine setups in nitrous, blower and turbo, featuring detailed coverage of all the racing action, updates on track conditions, and highlights of memorable moments.
